snippet: The growing confrontation between the United States and Russia has derailed an accord to expand collaboration on nuclear projects, including reciprocal visits to atomic sites by scientists.
abstract: Confrontation between United States and Russia over Ukraine has derailed accord that promised one of the most expansive collaborations ever between the countries' nuclear scientists; American officials say decision to freeze accord will limit how much each side knows about the other's capabilities and intentions after more than two decades in which their nuclear scientists worked alongside one another.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and WILLIAM J. BROAD

lead_paragraph: The growing confrontation between the United States and Russia has derailed an accord to expand collaboration on nuclear projects, including reciprocal visits to atomic sites by scientists.

headline.main: U.S.-Russia Nuclear Deal Stalls as Tensions Over Ukraine Rise
headline.print_headline: U.S.-Russia Nuclear Deal Stalls as Tensions Over Ukraine Rise
